title: Baked Potato Soup Recipe
description: This creamy baked potato soup is easy to make with leftover baked potatoes and loaded with crispy bacon bits, green onions, sour cream, and Cheddar.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes Soup Recipes Vegetable Soup Recipes Potato Soup Recipes Baked Potato Soup 4.7 (2,358) 1,771 Reviews 312 Photos This baked potato soup is thick, creamy, and an excellent way to use leftover baked potatoes. It's a family favorite in our house when it's cold and dark outside. Submitted by Sherry Haupt Updated on September 25, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 312 312 312 312 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 25 mins Total Time: 40 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe Baked potato soup is the perfect hearty, filling, stick-to-your-bones dinner for a cold winter's night. This baked potato soup recipe will quickly become a family favorite. Baked Potato Soup Ingredients These are the simple ingredients you'll need to make this top-rated baked potato soup recipe: Bacon: This baked potato soup starts with bacon cooked in a large skillet. Butter: You can also use margarine. Flour and milk: Whisk all-purpose flour and milk into the melted butter for a perfectly thick base. Baked potatoes: Try our Perfect Baked Potatoes recipe. Green onions: Chopped green onions lend bright, bold flavor and color. Seasonings: This baked potato soup is simply seasoned with salt and pepper. Cheese and sour cream: Shredded Cheddar cheese and sour cream ensure a rich and creamy soup. Best Potatoes for Baked Potato Soup Russet potatoes are perfect for this baked potato soup, as they'll break down beautifully during the cooking process. You can use Yukon Golds, but you might have to cook the soup a bit longer. Allrecipes Video How to Make Baked Potato Soup You'll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here's a brief overview of what you can expect when you make baked potato soup at home: Cook the bacon.Melt the butter, then whisk in the flour and milk.Add the potatoes and onions and bring to a boil.Reduce to a simmer, then stir in the remaining ingredients.Cook until the cheese is melted. Test Kitchen Tips “This is the perfect pot of potato soup,” says culinary producer Nicole McLaughlin (a.k.a. NicoleMcMom). Here are some of her expert tips:  While you definitely can boil and mash the potatoes if you prefer, Nicole recommends following the recipe by baking them in the oven — she finds the potatoes have a creamier texture. Pro-tip: Make this soup with leftover mashed potatoes from Thanksgiving. If you prefer a brothier soup, Nicole says, you can always add in a little chicken stock to cut the creaminess.  How to Store Baked Potato Soup Allow the baked potato soup to cool, then transfer the leftovers to an airtight container. Store in the refrigerator for up to five days. Reheat on the stove or in the microwave. Can You Freeze Baked Potato Soup? We don't recommend freezing baked potato soup. The cream and potatoes will become grainy and watering as they thaw, so you should try to enjoy this soup within five days. Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise "Absolutely delicious and easy," raves the1betsy. "I used finely chopped sweet onions and cooked them until translucent in the bacon drippings before draining and adding them. Raves from the family!" "Great recipe as is!" says Becky. "The only change I made was to leave some of the crumbled bacon aside to use as topping. Made this three different times and served it to different guests and all of them raved about it! A definite keeper!!" "This soup is delicious," according to Alice Russell Fulton. "My family loved it. Not difficult, but I would suggest baking the potatoes a day or more ahead to save time." Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 12 slices bacon ⅔ cup butter ⅔ cup all-purpose flour 7 cups milk 4 large baked potatoes, peeled and cubed 4 green onions, chopped 1 ¼ cups shredded Cheddar cheese 1 cup sour cream 1 teaspoon salt, or to taste 1 teaspoon ground black pepper Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 8 to 10 minutes. Drain bacon slices on paper towels; crumble and set aside. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Meanwhile, melt butter in a stockpot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Gradually add flour, whisking until well-combined. Slowly pour in milk, whisking constantly until smooth and thickened. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add potatoes and onions and bring to a boil, stirring frequently. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir in crumbled bacon, Cheddar cheese, sour cream, salt, and pepper. Continue cooking and stirring until cheese is melted. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 3,714 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Baked Potato Soup 01 of 312 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 312 Photo by  Christine Vaupel 01/27/2025 Was very creamy 03 of 312 Photo by  Marie Thomas 08/06/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Crowd-pleaser Family favorite Because I was only making this soup for myself and my husband, I cut the recipe in half, and it worked! I was thick and flavorful and very filling. I did add a 1/2 teaspoon of powdered chicken bouillon, and it added extra flavor to the soup. 04 of 312 Photo by  SneakyPork8642 05/20/2024 Great flavors A keeper! Worth the effort Family favorite Crowd-pleaser 05 of 312 Photo by  AceHam8274 05/07/2024 A keeper! Worth the effort Family favorite I baked my bacon and added an extra potato. I will be saving this and making it again. 06 of 312 Photo by  NimbleBran5944 12/03/2023 This recipe is wonderful!The only thing I did differently was roast some garlic and kept the skins on the baked potatoes.It is absolutely not something you can walk away from so make sure your baked potatoes and bacon are done in advance. This ensures that when you get to the rouxe you can focus on that. 07 of 312 Photo by  HeartyUdo2371 10/26/2023 Loved it! Used diced ham instead of bacon and added some minced garlic with the butter and added some cayenne for spice at the end. Delicious! 08 of 312 Photo by  Teresa Burris 10/14/2023 I made it and its better than some recipes I've found. Next time i will use less flour and i also made mine gluten-free because i have celiac and cant have gluten. I also did it on a budget and opted out the bacon. Lol 09 of 312 Photo by  cisston 02/06/2023 delicious, we didnt have bacon but we had ham. 10 of 312 Photo by  Anthony Berryman 12/01/2022 I used pink salt when baking the potatoes and then left the skin and salt on them when I cubed them. I didn’t blend the flour and milk into the butter at the same time, but instead dumped it all in and the whisked until the floor was fully dissolved. I thought the taste was quite good. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Hash Brown Potato Soup 26 Ratings Slow Cooker Loaded Potato Soup 39 Ratings Absolutely Ultimate Potato Soup 3,059 Ratings World's Best Potato Soup 420 Ratings Potato and Cheddar Soup 179 Ratings Bacon Cheeseburger Soup 3 Ratings Bacon and Potato Soup 498 Ratings Loaded Baked Potato Soup 30 Ratings Best Baked Potato Soup 940 Ratings Slow Cooker Potato-Bacon Soup 21 Ratings Ham, Potato, and Cheese Soup 274 Ratings Creamy Irish Potato Soup 28 Ratings ORE-IDA Slow-Cooker Loaded Potato Soup 24 Ratings Creamy Hash Brown Potato Soup 3 Ratings Very Easy Potato Bacon Soup 120 Ratings Potato Leek Soup with Bacon 753 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
